subject: OpenPOWER: Clear system and resource dump entries while powering off
commitMessage:
OpenPOWER: Clear system and resource dump entries while powering off

The dumps like system and resource dumps are stored in host memory
and that will be lost during a power off, so the entries in BMC
dump-manager for those dumps will be stale after a power off.
This commit adds a service to call deleteAll to clear the entries
for system and resource dumps during system power off.

Tests:
   1 - Created a resource dump and systemd dump
       and activated the service
       Result: Both dump entries are cleared

   2 - Created a resource dump and system dump
       powered off the system
       Result: Both dump entries are cleared

Signed-off-by: Dhruvaraj Subhashchandran <dhruvaraj@in.ibm.com>
Change-Id: I4e6a59ae852c86f5edbab767fb6a0ff2a4635289

RemainAfterExit defaults to no so with an oneshot service that means this service will run every time obmc-host-stop@0.target is called. The Conflicts are kind of redundant in that case. Nothing wrong with having them but just wanted to highlight this in case you'd prefer to add a "RemainAfterExit=yes" in which case this service would only run when one of the Conflicts first stops it.
Done
I believe the full path to the binary is needed here, i.e. /us/bin/busctl
it worked when I tested, other examples also not adding full path, but changing to full path.
Done
This is missing the .in?
here .in is not needed, looks like <filename>.in will be taken
This seems like a bit of overkill? We'll run when we stop the host but also when we start it? I don't see a reason behind this in the commit msg.
I will update the commit message, but this may be needed to handle  the EPO kind of scenarios? just added this to cover that scenario
Removing
After
Done
I'd think we just have this conflict with obmc-host-startmin@0.target to ensure we run it on every obmc-host-stop@0.target.
Remove this?
I like to put "RemainAfterExit=yes" under Service which are "oneshot" services to ensure they only run once and when we expect them to. This assume a valid "Conflicts" though.
Done
should we include host-start too?
no, only during poweroff
Why using "clear_hostdumps_poweroff.service" two times?
first one is location and second one is the service name

I think you used it because you want the unit file name alone for the output field in configure_file() If so, you can use an array of dictionaries that can have keys (which can use in the input field) and values (which can use in the output field).

For example, I hope the below sample code will work (I did not test this)

FYR: https://mesonbuild.com/Syntax.html#dictionaries and https://mesonbuild.com/Reference-manual.html#dictionary-object

```
# Root meson.build file 
unit_files = [{}]

foreach u : unit_files
    configure_file(
        configuration: unit_subs,
        input: u.get('input'),
        install: true,
        install_dir: systemd_system_unit_dir,
        output: u.get('output')
    )
endforeach

# Subdirectory meson.build file 

unit_files += { 'input': 'dump-extensions/openpower-dumps/clear_hostdumps_poweroff.service', 'output' : 'clear_hostdumps_poweroff.service' }

```

OR

Add a comment about the `unit_files` value expectation because you mentioned it as `[]` in the root meson.build file but using as `[[]]` in subdirectory meson.build file and using only first and second index in the root meson.build file.
Done
